description: Contact information for queries about claims that have been made for Disability Living Allowance, Personal Independence Payment and Attendance Allowance

details.body:
Get advice or information about a claim you’ve already made for Personal Independence Payment, Disability Living Allowance or Attendance Allowance.

This guide is also available in Welsh (Cymraeg).

Personal Independence Payment (PIP)

Telephone: 0800 121 4433
Textphone: 0800 121 4493
Relay UK (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0800 121 4433
British Sign Language (BSL) video relay service if you’re on a computer - find out how to use the service on mobile or tablet
Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm
Find out about call charges

There’s a different number if you want to make a claim for PIP.

Alternative formats

Call to ask for alternative formats, such as braille, large print or audio CD.

Disability Living Allowance (DLA)

If you’ve made a claim for Personal Independence Payment (PIP) and you want to talk about Disability Living Allowance, you need to call the PIP number instead.

If you were born after 8 April 1948

Telephone: 0800 121 4600
Textphone: 0800 121 4523 Relay UK (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0800 121 4600
British Sign Language (BSL) video relay service if you’re on a computer - find out how to use the service on mobile or tablet
Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm
Find out about call charges

If you were born on or before 8 April 1948

Telephone: 0800 731 0122
Textphone: 0800 731 0317 Relay UK (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0800 731 0122
British Sign Language (BSL) video relay service if you’re on a computer - find out how to use the service on mobile or tablet
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm
Find out about call charges

Alternative formats

Call to ask for alternative formats, such as braille, large print or audio CD.

Attendance Allowance (AA)

Telephone: 0800 731 0122
Textphone: 0800 731 0317
Relay UK (if you cannot hear or speak on the phone): 18001 then 0800 731 0122
British Sign Language (BSL) video relay service if you’re on a computer - find out how to use the service on mobile or tablet
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm
Find out about call charges

Alternative formats

Call to ask for alternative formats, such as braille, large print or audio CD.

Postal address for Personal Independence Payment (PIP)

Personal Independence Payment
Post Handling Site B
Wolverhampton
WV99 1AH

Postal address for DLA for adults (aged 16 and over)

If you were born after 8 April 1948

Department for Work & Pensions
Disability Living Allowance
Freepost RUEY-BBKJ-SXJH
Mail Handling Site A
Wolverhampton
WV98 2GJ

If you were born on or before 8 April 1948

Freepost DWP Disability Living Allowance 65

You do not need a postcode or a stamp.

Postal address for DLA for children (under 16)

Freepost DWP DLA Child

You do not need a postcode or a stamp.

If you’ve received a paper form, you can use the envelope included to return it.

Postal address for Attendance Allowance

Freepost DWP Attendance Allowance

You do not need a postcode or a stamp.

Complain about the Disability Service Centre

Contact the Department for Work and Pensions to complain about the Disability Service Centre.

mainstream_browse_pages.description: Help if you're living with a health condition or disability. Includes Employment and Support Allowance (ESA).
mainstream_browse_pages.title: Benefits and financial support if you're disabled or have a health condition

mainstream_browse_pages.description: Includes Disability Living Allowance, Employment and Support Allowance and Attendance Allowance
mainstream_browse_pages.title: Benefits and financial help

details.benefit: can get financial and other help with any challenges to my daily living
details.goal: apply for the schemes, grants and services available to get financial support and fund equipment, modifications to my home etc
justifications: It's something the government provides/does/pays for

meets_user_needs.title: As a disabled person, I need to apply for the schemes, grants and services available to get financial support and fund equipment, modifications to my home etc, so that can get financial and other help with any challenges to my daily living (103508)

details.benefit: I get financial and other help with caring for the child
details.goal: apply for the schemes, grants and services available
details.role: parent or carer of a disabled child

meets_user_needs.title: As a parent or carer of a disabled child, I need to apply for the schemes, grants and services available, so that I get financial and other help with caring for the child (103506)

details.benefit: I can get financial help for my personal care
justifications: The government is legally obliged to provide it
It's something that people can do or it's something people need to know before they can do something that's regulated by/related to government
There is clear demand for it from users
It's something the government provides/does/pays for
met_when: knows the eligibility criteria for attendance allowance
knows how much they would be entitled to if they qualify for attendance allowance
knows how to claim attendance allowance
knows how to appeal to the Social Security and Child Support Tribunal
understands how care and support is changing
details.role: person who is physically or mentally disabled and 65 or over

meets_user_needs.title: As a person who is physically or mentally disabled and 65 or over, I need to apply for attendance allowance, so that I can get financial help for my personal care (100243)

justifications: The government is legally obliged to provide it
It's inherent to a person's or an organisation's rights and obligations
It's something that people can do or it's something people need to know before they can do something that's regulated by/related to government
It's something the government provides/does/pays for
met_when: understands how the personal independence payment works
understands the eligibility for personal independence payment
understands how to claim personal independence payment
understands how to appeal against a decision about personal independence payment
understands how care and support is changing
details.role: someone with a long term health problem or disability

meets_user_needs.title: As a someone with a long term health problem or disability, I need to apply for personal independence payment (PIP), so that I am financially supported (100284)
